description:
buffer1
Buffer object
A buffer of bytes/words for other libraries that need a buffer
https://github.com/awgrover/xod-buffer
name: buffer1

@/buffer1.description:
Make a buffer of n bytes.
Only at beginning of program.
Allocates from the heap.
You must check ERR: means not-enough-free-memory

@/debug-dump.description: Dump the buffer to the console if debugging is on

@/defer(buffer1).description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

@/equal(buffer1).description: Outputs true if `IN1` = `IN2`, and false otherwise

HylpryFfV.content: You can see the buffer contents in the console

SJmhRoDfE.content:
buffer1
Buffer object
A buffer of bytes/words for other libraries that need a buffer

@/fill.description:
Fill the entire buffer with a value.
Default fill is 0.

i-value.description: Fills the buffer with this byte.
i-value.label: value

@/gate(buffer1).description: Allows values to pass through only if EN pin is set to true

@/if-else(buffer1).description: Outputs either input value depending on condition

S13xLCuHvkW.description: Outputs value of `T` if `COND` is true, and `F` otherwise
S13xLCuHvkW.label: R

r1AgIROHDJW.description: Value to be output if condition is false
r1AgIROHDJW.label: F

ryTeUROHD1b.description: Value to be output if condition is true
ryTeUROHD1b.label: T

readme.content:
# buffer1 Tutorial
A buffer for other libraries that need a pointer to a block of RAM.

rk-cjDKME.content:
## `length` is always available, and never changes.
So, it doesn't need pulses.

rkD1ruFG4.content:
In other words, only the constructor will originate a bad buffer,
though other nodes will pass it along.

rkMtfnDGE.content:
## Pre-fill with a value if needed.
The buffer has undefined data in it when you make it.
fill() uses 0 by default.

rkX1zdYMV.content:
## The nodes always emit the `buffer1`, but it might be bad.
## Nodes take no action if the input buffer is bad.

rkpim3PfV.content: Other nodes need the buffer, so a bus is often less messy.

ryDpMaPGN.content:
Remember this is the ith _word_. As if: 
`u_int16 buffer[]`
So, 15 is at byte 30 & 31.

ryv4B_Fz4.content:
## Nodes from other libraries CAN emit a bad buffer
Even if they received a good buffer. I can't control that!
